intro: Pelea pickeringii var. citriodorata, commonly known as the citron-scented pelea, is a rare and specialized plant native to specific regions in Mexico. It is characterized by its aromatic foliage, which emits a distinctive citrus-like fragrance. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its leaves are often narrow and lance-shaped, with a leathery texture. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
